intro: Hetaeria occidentalis, commonly known as the western hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided and have a mild, spicy fragrance. Hetaeria occidentalis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
